Chocolate Brownies
cm round pan
90g Butter
90g 60% Chocolate
35g 90% Chocolate
60g Whole Eggs
2.7g Instant Espresso Powder
5.2g Vanilla Extract
90g Sucrose (Sugar)
30g AP Flour (All-Purpose Flour)
3g Baking Powder
1.2g Sea Salt
70g Chocolate Chips
75g Walnuts
  1. Melt the butter, 60% and 90% chocolate, then allow to cool slightly
  2. In a bowl, stir (not whisk) together eggs, espresso powder, vanilla, and sugar
  3. Stir the chocolate mixture into the egg mixture
  4. Sift 25g flour, the baking powder, and the sea salt together.
  5. Use the remaining 5g flour to coat the chocolate chips and walnuts (this stops them sinking)
  6. Fold these dry ingredients into the wet mixture in 3 additions
  7. Grease a parchment-lined 18cm round pan, and pour in the batter
  8. Bake at 175C for 20 mins, then bang the pan to stop an air bubble forming between the brownies and the pan. Then bake until a toothpick comes out clean - probably around 10 minutes but go by testing not time
  9. Allow to cool before cutting
Notes
  • Be careful not to overmix the batter to maintain the fudgy texture.
  • Took them out at 92C in the center last time.
Adapted via Kathleen Meisinger from Ina Garten's Outrageous Brownie recipe.
